name: Gyeongbokgung Palace
description: The largest and most iconic of Seoul's Five Grand Palaces, featuring stunning architecture and the famous changing of the guard ceremony.

name: N Seoul Tower
description: Iconic observation tower offering panoramic views of Seoul, especially beautiful at sunset and night.

name: Myeongdong
description: Seoul's premier shopping district, famous for cosmetics, fashion, street food, and vibrant nightlife.

name: Bukchon Hanok Village
description: Traditional Korean village with hundreds of hanoks (traditional houses) dating back to the Joseon Dynasty.

name: Dongdaemun Design Plaza
description: Futuristic landmark designed by Zaha Hadid, hosting exhibitions, fashion shows, and late-night shopping.

name: Changdeokgung Palace
description: UNESCO World Heritage site known for its Secret Garden and harmonious integration with nature.

name: Gangnam District
description: Upscale district made famous by 'Gangnam Style', featuring luxury shopping, dining, and entertainment.

name: Namsan Park
description: Beautiful urban park surrounding N Seoul Tower, offering hiking trails and cherry blossoms in spring.

name: Insadong
description: Traditional culture street filled with art galleries, antique shops, traditional tea houses, and craft stores.

name: Han River Parks
description: Scenic riverside parks perfect for cycling, picnics, and enjoying Seoul's skyline, especially at sunset.

name: Lotte World Tower
description: Korea's tallest building with observation deck on 117-123F offering breathtaking views of Seoul.

name: Namdaemun Market
description: Korea's largest traditional market with over 600 years of history, selling everything from clothes to souvenirs.

name: War Memorial of Korea
description: Comprehensive museum showcasing Korea's military history with indoor and outdoor exhibitions.

name: Hongdae
description: Youthful district near Hongik University, known for indie culture, street performances, clubs, and cafes.

name: Deoksugung Palace
description: Uniquely features both Korean traditional and Western-style architecture, famous for its stone wall road.

name: Olympic Park
description: Built for the 1988 Olympics, now a vast park with sculptures, walking paths, and sports facilities.

name: Jogyesa Temple
description: The chief temple of Korean Buddhism, beautiful during Buddha's birthday with thousands of lanterns.

name: COEX Mall
description: Asia's largest underground shopping mall featuring the famous Starfield Library and COEX Aquarium.

name: Seoul Forest
description: Large park with deer feeding area, butterfly conservatory, and beautiful walking trails along the Han River.

name: Changgyeonggung Palace
description: Often overlooked palace with beautiful gardens, greenhouse, and peaceful atmosphere away from crowds.
